text: Judy Quinn (born 1974) is a Canadian writer and editor living in Quebec. ==Biography== She was born in Quebec City and studied literature at the Université du Québec à Montréal and the Université de Toulouse-Le Mirail in France. She is literary critic and editor for the literary journal Nuit blanche. She also has contributed to various publications including Le Devoir. Quinn published three collections of poetry: L'émondé (2008), Six heures vingt (2010) and Les damnés inflationnistes' (2012). She received the and the for her poetry. In 2012, she published a novel Hunter s'est laissé couler which received the Prix Robert-Cliche; it was also a finalist for the . In 2013, she was writer in residence at the Cité internationale des arts in Paris. == References == Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian women journalists Category:Canadian women poets Category:Canadian poets in French Category:Canadian novelists in French Category:Writers from Quebec City Category:Université du Québec à Montréal alumni Category:21st-century Canadian poets Category:21st-century Canadian novelists Category:Canadian women novelists Category:21st-century Canadian women writers Category:Canadian women non-fiction writers
title: Judy Quinn
